Text: Bermuda night heron:  It was first described in 2006 by Storrs L. Olson and David B. Wingate from subfossil material found in the Pleistocene and Holocene deposits in caves and ponds of Bermuda.
Triplets:<Bermuda night heron
3:
--------------------
Text: Bermuda night heron:  Its anatomy was rather similar to its living relative, the yellow-crowned night heron ("N. violacea"), but it had a heavier bill, a more massive skull and more robust hind limbs.
